_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: removal of glass in hazardous service equipment
_prev_prog_3.Description: The Grace Baton Rouge facility, for the purpose of RMP, can be considered a single process which contains several operating units.  Safeguards which pertain to all units include: Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), Layer of Protection Analysis (LOPA), Operating Procedures, Training, Pre-startup Safety Review, Mechanical Integrity program, Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Emergency Planning and Response, & Compliance Audits.  Process controls for all units include vents, relief valves and rupture discs, check valves, flares, manual shutoffs, interlocks, alarms and procedures, emergency air supply, backup firewater pumps, firewater deluge systems, grounding equipment, purge systems, and hydrocarbon detectors.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Grace Baton Rouge



211377 LADEQ Facility ID Number



The Grace Baton Rouge facility is a production facility which supports R&D efforts for conducting laboratory, pilot plant, and market development scale research to develop specialty catalyst products.  At this site, Grace produces sample quantities (1 kg level) to commercial quantities of various specialty catalysts.



Currently Grace Baton Rouge has on site RMP covered levels of one flammable chemical (diethyl ether) handled above RMP threshold quantity and no toxic materials above RMP threshold quantities.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies - In its operations, Grace is committed to the safety of the surrounding community, as well as protection of the environment.  With a strong Process Safety Management program in place, Grace combines both passive and active mitigation systems to prevent offsite consequences in the event of a spill of any hazardous material.  In addition, our highly trained Emergency Response team is always available to respond to any incident, and bring it quickly under control.  Emergency responders are trained annually, and a trained Incident Commander is on site at all times to coordinate emergency response procedures.



Five Year Accident History - There have been no offsite accidents at this location that had any adverse effects to neighboring industry or the community.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety - Grace is committed to an ever improving safety program to maintain its rating in the top 5% in the chemical industry.  We conduct Process Hazards Analyses (PHA) of all chemical operations including lab safety audits for all bench scale processes for new projects.  We conduct Layer of Protection Analysis (LOPA) to improve the quality of PHA studies to ensure thoroughness and effectiveness.  We also conduct reactive hazard evaluations on all processes, with the goal of identifying reactive hazards which might occur during normal or upset conditions.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program - Grace employs the latest technology in its process controls, monitoring, and mitigation systems to ensure that accidental releases are prevented or the risks associated with them are minimized.  Process documentation for covered processes are in compliance with OSHA 1910.119 requirements for Process Safety Management (PSM).  Equipment inspections are scheduled and documented to ensure vessel mechanical integrity.  Hydrocarbon detectors are strategically located to detect the release of flammable materials.
